dish_description: The dish is a sausage papillote, which involves cooking sausage with vegetables and seasonings in an aluminum foil pouch in the oven. It's a simple, versatile recipe that can be prepared with various ingredients.

cooking_steps.description: Prepare the kielbasa sausage by removing most of the skin. You can also use different types of sausage available at the market.
Cut a large piece of aluminum foil, approximately 20 by 20 inches, to create the papillote (casing) for the sausage and vegetables.
Slice the potatoes and onions, and prepare cloves of garlic, carrots, and any slightly dark but fine mushrooms.
Add flavorings such as fresh thyme, bay leaves, a dash of salt, Tabasco, and some olive oil to the mix.
Assemble the papillote by placing the sausage and vegetables on the aluminum foil, then fold and seal the foil, making sure not to wrap it too tightly to allow space for steam to develop.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and cook the papillote for close to an hour.
After cooking, carefully open the papillote, being cautious of the hot steam.
Serve the sausage papillote directly in the foil, garnishing with a little bit of herbs, and enjoy the fully cooked sausage and potatoes.
